snippet: As the Metropolitan Opera tries to win concessions from its unions, labor talks are laying bare details of life at the Met, from what performers earn to box office struggles.
abstract: Metropolitan Opera is trying to win concessions from its unions by the end of July 2014, and labor talks are laying bare details of life at the Met, from what performers earn to box office struggles; labor strife threatens to delay the next season; Met wants to cut pay and benefits of its workers, who are among best paid in their fields.
lead_paragraph: As the Metropolitan Opera tries to win concessions from its unions, labor talks are laying bare details of life at the Met, from what performers earn to box office struggles.

headline.main: Not Over Till Overtime’s Due? Met Labor Strife Bares Secrets
headline.print_headline: Not Over Till Overtime’s Due? Met Labor Strife Bares Secrets
